title: Veigar - The Counter Mage.... That Get's Countered By Every Mage.....
body:
Two primary types of AP champions, assassins and poke. Right now Veigar gets beat by both and his only counter against them is that he can ult them late-game for nearly all of their hp. Assassins like Leblanc Ahri can 100% Veigar pre-6 while he has to wait to 100% them until 20-30 minutes into the game, and that's only if they run into his stun. Poke champions like Xerath and Ziggs are the same. They can poke him and Veigar cant poke back. he can only 100% them if they are way out of position and it's late game.

I think it's time Veigar lost the "counter mage" identity considering he doesn't even fulfill it right now.

Edit:

The reason for this post is because of every post regarding a change to his ultimate. They all get down-voted and receive negative comments because it would remove his identity as a "counter-mage", which was already removed from him. I'm not saying his ult needs to be changed. I'm just saying the argument of him still being a counter-mage doesn't hold.

Solid points, but my counter argument is as follows,

1. Veigar's identity is _not_ an antimage.
2. Veigar's identity is as a growing threat in the form of a mage.

Veigar has one of the worst early games in League of Legends. He just does. Period. Even characters wtih "bad" early games (like vayne for instance) can whup his ass like a red headed stepchild early game.

Veigar's fantasy is that growth in power, as every minion you Q feeds your growing AP, until you eventually have something over 600 or so and can smash over half of a fighter's health bar with one meteor.

3. I do not believe veigar's ultimate has an enemy AP ratio to make him an anti-mage.

4. I'd argue that Veigar's ultimate's special ratio is designed to give Veigar a niche strength. The idea is that late game, no matter how badly veigar does, he will still turn whatever mage spent the early game stomping his ass into paste. No matter how fed Malzahar, or Orianna, or Brand got beating your sorry blue ass black and blue you will still be able to splat them late game. Your lane opponent (provided they are a mage. Still the most common mid pick) will eventually fall before you. 

The idea is that if veigar does well, his growth feeds into him murdering everyone. If he really doesn't bounce back though, at least he can kill the mage he likely laned against.

As well thought out as this post is, you clearly didn't know him before his rework. Or really in the past at all.

His power fantasy was THE anti-mage burst-mage. His Q stacking minigame, to my knowledge, has actually never been particularly used by players who are good at him. They've always used his Q to harass so that come level 6 they can instantly kill the enemy and get snowballing.

Look at his release kit, please. Realize that he was **definitely intended to be the game's anti-mage.**

*     Entropy (Passive) - Veigar's attacks steal 5 Ability Power per strike for 8 seconds. This effect stacks.

*     Baleful Strike - Unleashes dark energy at target enemy dealing Magic Damage. If a unit is killed, Veigar gains 1 Ability Power for a minion or 5 Ability Power for a champion.

*     Dark Matter - After 2 seconds, dark matter falls from the sky to the target location, dealing Magic Damage.

*     Event Horizon - Veigar twists the edges of space around the target location for 3 seconds, stunning enemies who pass through the perimeter for a short duration.

*     Primordial Burst (Ultimate) - Blasts target enemy champion, dealing Magic Damage plus 25% of the target's maximum Mana. If Primordial Burst deals a killing blow, Veigar regains Mana.


He stole AP and did damage based on the target's mana. The next ability rework:

*  Entropy REMAKE
       Auto attacks lower the target's ability power by 25% (non-stacking).

He lowered the opponent's AP by **25%.** Clearly antimage.

Next up!:

*  Entropy REMAKE
      Veigar steals 20% of each nearby champion's ability power. The amount stolen per target cannot exceed five times Veigar's level.

That seems pretty antimage to me. Passively stealing 20% of everybody's AP.

Eventually they changed it to the current equilibrium. That same patch, to maintain his anti-mage identity, they changed his ult to 80% of the enemy's AP and his AP combined. Next patch, it was 1.0 of both of their AP's. Next, it is what it was until the rework, 80% of theirs, and 120% of his.

He is very, very clearly, historically an anti-mage that is meant to burst them to death. That was and should be his entire thing. He was never intended to be this Q-stacking thing. That was just a bonus when farming after you blew up the enemy champion (why do you think killing them also rewards 1/2/3/4/5 AP?)

Looking into the past gives you a good feeling of what the champion was intended to be. Riot just changed their minds a few patches ago because he was being played as support and they just won't have that, now will they?

(Also, just a side-note, his meteor doesn't take 50% of anyone's HP away right now, its impossible to land just like his E is)
He is not a counter mage. Kassadin is a counter mage. Veigar's niche is precisely what you're complaining about... If you don't like it, pick a different champ.

I haven't played since beta, but for around 1-2 years I played veigar only, and I stopped playing the game when dfg removal happened in wait of a compensation. It may not be for the longest of times but 1-2 years is still a good amount.

Let's clarify my thoughts on him being an anti-mage. Firstly let me say, I don't understand why people consider him to be one. He's an anti-anyone who builds flat Ap with no utility champion if anything. So people like leblanc was what veigars ult was truely good against.

Now here's why I don't think he should be an antimage or even considered one. There are **a lot** of champions who are played mid who are AD or don't really build that much AP. It's actually to the point you don't even consider the bonus damage from enemy AP, it's just too inconsistent, and if something is too inconsistent you just don't add it to the 'plan'. 

Referring back to pre dfg removal, the general rule was, if you didn't have a decent amount of health and/or MR, veigar would instantly kill you. It didn't matter if you were Zed, khaz, leblanc, ezreal, caitlyn, oriana, syndra, or wh ever, without health and/or mr you were going to die or you were going to live. 

From all my experiences I've never once noticed the bonus enemy ap damage really mattering. I've played veigar at a fairly high level for a couple of years and I've never considered tabulating the enemy AP as damage. 

I never looked at the enemy AP and tried to figure out if it'd kill them. I never considered him an anti mage, I considered him an anti-anyone with low hp/mr, because that's what he was. He was a nuker, no reason to attach anti-mage because he was just as good against the AD casters.

Now what are my proposed changes? I've thought about it a couple of times on how to make him more fun with his current skill set, but I haven't really thought about a real rework.

His passive needs to be changes. As it is it sucks, and I've never liked it. It gives you much less than you think when you consider his overall mana costs. Useless passive.

His E needs a rework just flat out. Just keeping it as a cage I would add augmentations to his pre existing skills. 

When his Q passes through the walls they penetrate all targets within, and maybe gets a jayce treatment in that it speeds up, and gets bigger with more damage till it hits the other side of the cage and disappears. This would fix the issue where people can just kill you in return if you trap them inside for them to 'dance' around. 

When you use his W inside the box, drop time is instant, maybe more damage. 

R change, I'd like to have the enemy AP scaling removed, it was always a stupid mechanic, and then increase it's scaling up to 130%, then have it do 150% when hitting an enemy in the box.
